H0.text: What science does Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's creation, Sherlock Holmes, practise. Criminology

H1.text: What science does Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's creation, Sherlock Holmes, practise. Psychology

H2.text: What science does Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's creation, Sherlock Holmes, practise. Forensics

H3.text: What science does Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's creation, Sherlock Holmes, practise. Detection

A5.text: He uses analytical chemistry for blood residue analysis and toxicology to detect poisons; Holmes's home chemistry laboratory is mentioned in 'The Naval Treaty'.

A6.text: Ballistics feature in 'The Adventure of the Empty House' when spent bullets are recovered to be matched with a suspected murder weapon, a practice which became regular police procedure only some fifteen years after the story was published.
